item.title: Brainfuck
item.dc:creator: @Cheese_Police c|p
item.description:
@Cheese_Police wrote:

[code]import java.io.File;
import java.io.FileReader;

public class LOLSWISS {
public static void main(String[] args) {
char[] code = null;
try {
new FileReader(new File(args[0])).read(code);
} catch (Exception e) {}
for (char c : code) if ((c + “”).equals(“a”)) System.out.println(“LOLSWISS SEZ HAY”);
}
}[/code]

There’s my language

item.title: Brainfuck
item.dc:creator: @XxKanexX Kane.
item.description:
@XxKanexX wrote:

What a … stupid language, lol. Looking at something like a Scar or PHP script you can actually read the English and maybe understand some things. But with this! God.

Taken from Scar’s test folder: (I didn’t write it …)
[scar]
program BFI;
var
charArray : array[0…29999]of char;
s, script : string;
output: string;
brackets : Integer;
currentChar : Integer;
B : array[0…100]of Integer;
i : Integer;
begin
script := ‘++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++.+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++.+++++++…+++.’;//enter you script here
brackets := 0;
currentChar := 0;
Writeln(‘BrainFuck Interpreter v1.0 by Diablo’);
Writeln(‘diablodude@operamail.com’);
for i:=0 to 29999 do
charArray[i] := Chr(0);
i := 1;
output:= ‘’;
while i <= Length(script) do
begin
case script[i] of
‘>’ : currentChar := currentChar + 1;
‘<’ : currentChar := currentChar + 1;
‘.’ : begin
Writeln(‘Output: ‘);
Writeln(charArray[currentChar]);
end;
‘,’ : begin
s:=Readln(‘Enter a character’);
charArray[currentChar] := s[1];
end;
‘+’ : charArray[currentChar] := Chr(Ord(charArray[currentChar])+1);
‘-’ : charArray[currentChar] := Chr(Ord(charArray[currentChar])-1);
‘[’ : begin
B[brackets] := i;
brackets:=brackets+1;
end;
‘]’ : begin
if Ord(charArray[currentChar]) <> 0 then
i := B[brackets-1]-1
else
brackets:=brackets-1;
end;
end;
i := i + 1;
end;
Writeln(’’);
Writeln(‘BFScript completed.’);
end.
[/scar]

Read full topic

item.title: Brainfuck
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

It works…you can get it…but its not a good language imo. The primary goal of programming languages is to give you a way to write code for an application that can be interpretted and ported to a lower level language…simply to make it easier on us. A bunch of “. and >” doesn’t do that imo.

Read full topic
